duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage and oversee the execution of manufacturing schedules and assure the application of all production, test, development, documentation, and safety standards.
Utilize Lean concepts to reduce and manage WIP and inventory and improve material flow.
Assist in formulation of business plan including capital improvements and projection of plant production capabilities.
Prepare reports and analysis of various cost control, production, labor, quality, facility usage, and other reports.
Conduct studies to ensure the plant continues to operate in a cost-efficient manner as technology, legal, regulatory policy, and product changes are implemented.

Perform those administrative activities necessary for the effective management of the department, including selection and development of employees, budget administration, employee counseling, and motivation, and organization goals and objectives.
Plan, organize, integrate, and measure the work performed within the department.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or a related field is required. Master’s degree preferred.
3 to 5 years of materials focus experience in a manufacturing environment using SAP
5 or more years of experience in inventory or production control
